ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
expanded my ability to think openly about what art should look like/ feel like
introduction to new materials & mediums
space to fellowship w/ other artists -- learning from them & sharing experiences

I was able to develop so many new skills and insights about approaching art, whether it's producing or viewing a piece. I found the course to show how engaging and creative the making process can be, and was able to explore so many new methods, modes, and mediums for expression!
I felt like this class served more as a space for experimentation in art rather than an explicit learning space. That is not to say that emphasis on experimentation is a bad thing for a class.
I learned a lot about collage

I developed a lot of skills in abstraction and experimentation. We used a lot of mediums that arent dealt with in a traditional art class, so I was able to build experience with those mediums and learn from others.
I learned how to make an effective composition. I was introduced to ideas I'd never heard of before, like blurring the foreground and background.
This course gives a good foundation for anyone interested in art and exploring new technique.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths - creation of a comfortable & understanding space, introduction to new materials & mediums
weaknesses - the session was a bit long from 330-520 meeting twice a week
I enjoyed the structure and teaching methods of this class- definitely one of my favorite classes I have ever taken!!
Sometimes we got too much time for a project

The strengths of this course was that there was a lot of room for experimentation and learning. I also liked how we gave feedback to each other and learned our own strengths / styles in art. A weakness would be that the class time was kind of long so I felt less engaged near the end of classes.
This course taught me how to think visually.

The strengths are that the course provides the opportunity to explore a lot of different and new mediums.
The weakness is that crits are often long and unclear.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! So great for majors and non-majors.
Yes! It was a wonderful opportunity to expand my understanding of artistry & to learn about inspiring artists.
Yes! Everyone should take this class--whether you are intending to major in art or not. It is a wonderful experience and opens you to new perspectives and material in the creating process.

I would recommend this course to another student who was looking to take an art class that wasnt an art major. Although visual thinking is required for art majors, I felt like as a student who was more serious about art-making that the class was not challenging enough. Assignments were very flexible, which is a strength, but critiques were not rigorous, and it was on youas a self-directed studentto challenge yourself. On the individual scale, this system works, but when you are expected to be in the same class with a lot of other students who arent as serious, its disheartening and un-motivating.
Sure if theyre and art major
I recommend this course to any art student who wants to try new mediums and build their own styles. Its not a technique-based class so I think anyone could take this class and learn from it.
Yes I would. I learned how to make good artistic compositions in this course.
I would recommend this course to both artists and non artists- it is a great course to experiment.
